topic.title: Why should we care about survival of the humankind in the long run?
topic.body: I'm interested in any reasons, be it religious, philosophical, ethical. Is there any logic behind this? Why is it important, why does it matter? It's something which seems like some kind of "axiom", because at first the intuition says "we should care", but when I think about it for a while, I can't find any actual reasons why.

1574848015_144CwRj8eynTUC9DtGHaNHR3wm9P2.body: Telepathy is way cheaper and energy-efficient.

1574806526_14dsVvztuXjBxWmk4s4HjUnxuN4Ae.body:
Games are good. Sometimes great. Sometimes just fine.
And you don't have to spend money, you can just pirate it from torrents, or play free games.

> [somuchfood](#comment_32_14dsVvztuXjBxWmk4s4HjUnxuN4AeNaVvk): Since I became privacy-conscious, gaming became a huge problem. I don't want to infect my Linux with Steam or any other binary shit. If I buy a console, I will at least have separation of games, but still support $ony or Micro$oft and fucking DRMs, microtransactions, pay-to-multiplayer etc. So I'm considering just fucking it all and giving up gaming

You can also buy second PC.

1574608682_1CYE9ryvvXCW4CJPX51T24BFD62cy.body:
> [aspidochelone](#comment_269_1PPUrYcZ1E1rGkkE6PH18Qi43LRsKABo1Z): The "content expires in six months" thing pegs my bullshit-O-meter.  The COPS will have that content.  The WANNABE-COPS will have that content also - you can bet your ass Canary Mission will have an archive of every fucking word, so will the animal freaks and every other hardcore SJW/mob shakedown outfit bent on trying to blackmail people for saying the "wrong" opinion.  So what on Earth is the point of censoring the posts from the people you WANT to have read them?

Maybe the point is simply optimization, or better to say "preventing overflow of content", which is needed due to the way it works. This is just a hypothesis though, I don't know for sure. If this is the case, I think zeronet's merger sites is a better solution.

1575059165_1KmgiKWNNV8ACroT3aQzf3JA2E3Jt.body: This is not about IQ at all. It's more about what people actually like to do vs what they need to do to live in society. Maybe someone likes to program for 3 hours a day and only likes to write programs for lisp machines, but 99% of job market forces a 8 hour policy and asks to write javascript, so they need to invent ways to trick the system to minimize damage to their psychics and to maximize their well-being.

1575246757_17UaTuxP639VqVnepbKXm14qsD8Fv.body: Not only in internet mate. Cameras are everywhere. State-sponsored street roleplayers and gang-stalkers are on rise. And after you do EEG who knows what modern devices can do when calibrated to that data. Also I believe most of left-vs-right discourse exists just to polarize people to make them more easily manipulatable.

1575419519_17UaTuxP639VqVnepbKXm14qsD8Fv.body: I'd like to remind that even if something here is wrong or biased, it doesn't mean all post is wrong. This is an obvious thing, but still, it has to be mentioned more often. Because people tend to generalize their bad impressions on a single sentence to the whole post, or even to everything from the author, calling him/her a crazy schizo and distrusting everything he/she writes. By the way, this effect is used to discredit truth by putting it together with shitty nonsense.

1575385168_14dsVvztuXjBxWmk4s4HjUnxuN4Ae.body:
> [edgelordofdecent](#comment_303_1PGTHAmvu7K2PM7qqfoKyWv69aJsAaJQp5): The people that are interested in seeding won't be seeding for very long.

There is a category of people who don't need to do it now, but understand, things may become so bad, that there will be a need for this later. But, the information here is lacking tbh. Not much methods, not much pill cocktails, I definitely would like more, especially "peaceful" style methods.

1575467766_1CKTRBy9N4RvE3FgeZJpQqFYtLHc3.body: Blockchains can be used as a mechanism of decentralized consensus and even as a platform for decentralized programs and so called "smart contracts", but still very few projects use it like this. Most just do yet another cryptocurrency, sadly.

1576494373_1CKTRBy9N4RvE3FgeZJpQqFYtLHc3.body:

"Open source" means that the code repository is public. It seems you have something different in mind.

1577287962_1A5tKMypMZW14oHJLbe3rh9Va44Ms.body:
Today the peer numbers seem to really be little bit lower than average, not that much.
I think the reason might be many people are celebrating Christmas and are away from their computers.

1577571372_1CKTRBy9N4RvE3FgeZJpQqFYtLHc3.body: Computer is not input/output, it's input/state/output. Computer program is able to store state and "look back" to this state "retrospectively". But, defining "consciousness" as "ability to look back" (which in technical words is "ability to examine state") is pretty disputable.

1577612746_16dnrZKRMLhQCjv6nxx7tP5KJ2H2P.body: After thinking about this for a while, it seems the best choice (after http://127.0.0.1:43110 and webproxy gateways) is actually some giant forum system like reddit or a big imageboard with a lot of active subs. Because in places like that you can ask people to get anything you need from the rest of the internet. And they will be able to post it to you as text or rarjpg. ZeroMe will probably work great in this scenario, maybe it's even possible to post a 100gb rarjpg, but the population is pretty low and it might take more time to find somebody to help you.

1579208009_1NZftAz9VSawGF5JgMYGFv4ByoKEa.body: For underweight people, my suggestion for insomnia would be to try microdose quetiapine and alcohol (this is only for insomnia, sleep quality in this case may be suboptiomal, and you can get some incredible nightmares, imo it's still much better than few hours of sleep per night less due to severe insomnia). And for actual depression, ie Major Depressive Disorder, try St John's Wort in pills standartized to both hypericin and hyperforin.
